content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Yes, very simple, and it works in both CoC mode. 

I have proposed a variant of your CoC, without know the existence of your contribution. If you want have a look, it's here :

https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/58264a2dd01002ffe9cc78c0a73ce4bf0c60

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A nice way to calculate distance

My js short way solution (173 chars)

r=readline,h=r().split(' ')[1];for(i=1;i<=h;i++){s=r();if((f=s.indexOf('A'))>=0){x=i;y=f}if((f=s.indexOf('B'))>=0){z=i;w=f}}console.log(Math.round(((x-z)**2+(y-w)**2)**0.5))

Here is mine:
y=readline
for(k=y().split` `[1];k--;)[...y()].map((x,i)=>x!=`A`?x!=`B`?0:(q=k,w=i):(e=k,r=i))
print(Math.round(((e-q)**2+(r-w)**2)**.5))

I'm not trying to flex, just wanted to share some js tricks since golf is basically a context of tricks.
